entry.et: Middle English, from Old English scip; akin to Old High German skif ship

def.dt: :a large seagoing vessel
:a sailing vessel having a bowsprit and usually three masts each composed of a lower mast, a topmast, and a topgallant mast
:boat
:one propelled by power or sail
:a ship's crew
:fortune 3 when their ship comes in they'll be able to live in better style
:airship airplane spacecraft
:to place or receive on board a ship for transportation by water
:to cause to be transported shipped him off to prep school
:to provide with a ship
:to put in place for use ship the tiller
:to take into a ship or boat ship the gangplank
:to engage for service on a ship
:to take (as water) over the side used of a boat or a ship
:to embark on a ship
:to go or travel by ship often used with out
:to proceed by ship or other means under military orders often used with out
:to engage to serve on shipboard
:to be sent for delivery the order will ship soon

entry.et: Middle English, from Old English -scipe; akin to Old High German -scaft -ship, Old English scieppan to shape shape

def.dt: :state :condition :quality friendship
:office :dignity :profession clerkship
:art :skill horsemanship
:something showing, exhibiting, or embodying a quality or state township fellowship
:one entitled to a (specified) rank, title, or appellation his Lordship
:the body of persons participating in a specified activity readership listenership
:hardtack called also ship bread
:the affairs of a state symbolized as a ship on a course
:a large warship
:a square-rigged warship having at least two gun decks and designed to be positioned for battle in a line with other such ships
isolated mountain 7178 feet (2188 m) New Mexico in NW corner
:the papers a ship is legally required to carry for due inspection to show the character of the ship and cargo
:to ship (goods) from a manufacturer or wholesaler directly to a customer instead of to the retailer who took the order
:to ship goods from a supplier directly to a customer
:a ship equipped to process a whale or fish catch at sea
